Michael Caine and Britt Ekland pictured together, on day one of shooting Michael

Michael Caine and Britt Ekland pictured together, on day one of shooting Michael Caines new film, Get Carter.

The film is based around gang warfare when Michael goes North to the Newcastle area, to avenge a death.

The story follows a London gangster, the eponymous Jack Carter (Caine), who travels back to his hometown to discover more about the events surrounding his brother Franks supposedly accidental death. Suspecting foul play, he investigates and interrogates, regaining a feel for the city and its hardened-criminal element; with vengeance on his mind, the situation builds to a violent conclusion. Britt Ekland plays Anna, a gangsters moll.

This picture taken in London at the very start of filming.

Picture taken 20th July 1970

Peter Stone

Daily Mirror

EDITORS COMMENTS

Michael Caine and Britt Ekland, two iconic actors of the 1970s, captured together on day one of shooting Michael Caine's highly anticipated film, Get Carter. This gritty drama revolves around gang warfare as Michael's character ventures to Newcastle to seek revenge for his brother's mysterious death. The story follows Jack Carter (Caine), a London gangster who delves into the dark underbelly of his hometown in search of answers. As suspicions arise, he fearlessly interrogates and immerses himself in the city's criminal world, ultimately leading to a violent climax. In this photo taken during filming in London on July 20th, 1970, we see Michael Caine and Britt Ekland exuding their undeniable star power. Dressed impeccably for the era, Ekland portrays Anna—a seductive gangster's moll who adds an intriguing layer to the narrative. Their chemistry is palpable even off-screen. This snapshot from Memory Lane Prints not only encapsulates the excitement surrounding this groundbreaking film but also serves as a reminder of the talent that defined cinema during that era. Both Caine and Ekland became synonymous with their roles in Get Carter—solidifying their status as legendary figures in British cinema history. For fans of classic films or those interested in exploring vintage photography from significant moments in cinematic history, this print offers a glimpse into an unforgettable collaboration between two remarkable actors.
